data.title: Outdated Crown Plaza
data.text:
Had to stay here while in town for a meeting. This Crown Plaza is a holdover from the 90's. Everything about this place is old. Once I received my key and figured out how to get to my room, thru the rain. The smell was horrible. Thought it might just be the elevator, but it was on the entire floor. I could never get the room temperature right. Fro $200 a night, you would think Holiday Inn would do some sprucing up of this place.
 I even left a note to the Housekeeper about getting some Regular coffee, since I had (4) packages of Decaf and (1) Regular. When I got back that evening, still had the (4) Decaf and (1) Regular coffee. So much for that request.
I will never stay here again.

data.title: In on Business
data.text: The Crowne Plaza is a great place to stay.  I came in on business and found the staff to be extremely professional.  The facilities were well maintained and the accommodations were outstanding.  Crowne Plaza Silicon Valley North/Union City has my highest recommendation.

data.title: Stay Away if you are on business
data.text: I stay at a lot of hotel for business and I have now found my number 1 worst hotel for 329.00 a night. Old, smells, towels are fraying, carpet dirty, no screens on windows, filled with tour groups on buses slamming doors all night and trash in hallways. All for the low price of 329.00 a night! Positive? Close to 880 - that is it. This hotel doesn't deserve the Crowne Plaza name.

data.title: Friendly staff, nice looking place....NOISY!
data.text:
I stayed here on business in July 2016. Luckily, I only had to stay one night, but the one night I did spend there was not what I would call a relaxing, quiet hotel.

From what I've been told, the hotel is undergoing renovation and if you get a room in their new tower, those are nice and new. But I wasn't so lucky. I stayed in a room by their pool on the second floor. 

The hotel grounds were well maintained and the hotel itself is a nice looking place. The staff was very courteous and efficient. I arrived just before a large tour bus pulled up and had to check in about 40 people. The staff did a good job of having one associate helping the tour bus and the other associate working on checking in the other guests and kept the line moving. 

My room was musty smelling. It just smelled old, probably why they are doing renovations. They had a nice looking bar/restaurant area but I didn't use that. The room features and lights all worked properly and there were no stains or major defects in fixtures. 

I did have to wake up early in the morning for work and unfortunately, there were very noisy guests not only on my floor, but in the room above me. Kids that were running around the halls yelling until well past 11pm. The building was not designed to dampen the sound of footsteps well and I found getting a good night sleep was not going to happen. The pillows were so big my head was kicked at a 45 degree angle and was not very comfortable. 

My options for hotel accommodations were not up to me, and were made by my company. For one night, I could handle the noise, but if I had to stay there for an extended period of time I would have requested a room in the new tower. 

I don't know what other hotels there are in the surrounding area, but I would imagine this isn't the best or the worst. Overall, I would say this place is below average but the staff makes up for it.

data.title: Spacious room with a view
data.text:
Stayed here for one night using our IHG points. We were informed our room (833) was upgraded and it was  a huge corner room with a good view of the mountains. 

There was a mini ref, microwave and coffee maker in the room. The couch was a sofa bed so it works for us since we were 3. The bathroom was spacious.  The king bed and pillows were comfy.  The room was also quiet. There was no free breakfast. The lounge for members were close since it was a weekend. It was close to restaurants so eating out is not a problem.

The service at the frontdesk was friendly and efficient. We also had to request for our sheets to be change at 10 pm. I would have given them a bad review for this but since they were able to get someone to change our sheets (even if their housekeeping was already close at this time) I have to give them credit for that.

Parking and wifi are free. Overall we had a good stay at this hotel.

data.title: Felt like they put horrible pillows to torture guests instead
data.text:
I stayed at this hotel for one night.  Everything else was good.  Receptionist was friendly and helpful.  The building was under remodeling. The worst thing about this hotel is that the pillows are super hard and tall. It's extremely uncomfortable or possibly the most uncomfortable pillows I have ever slept on. I can't even use words to describe the level of discomfort for the pillows. So I spent the whole night being super uncomfortable and did not get any sleep. 
One final summary: crown plaza is not what it used to be anymore.

data.title: Read this before you book this dismal hotel
data.text: My colleague and I stayed here on business in May 2016. It was promoted as a non-smoking hotel, but the entire hotel, especially the public areas on the first floor, reeked of cigaret smoke. The rooms and hallways had a musty smell. My bathroom was dirty (I took pictures of the dust above the vanity and hair on the countertops). My window overlooking the pool had a huge crack in it. I'm a heavy sleeper, but my colleague, who was in the room next door, complained of the bus loads of people dropped off late at night at a door near our rooms. She had to call the desk twice about the rowdy people in the hallways. I wanted a wake-up call, but neither of the phones in my room worked. So, I had to call the desk from my cell phone and wait for a very rude employee to fix one of the phones. If this were a leisure trip, we would have moved to a different hotel. However, our employer booked our rooms, so we were stuck there for two nights.

data.title: A fair hotel getting a facelift
data.text:
Booked this hotel for business and I was here for three nights.  The hotel is unique in that there are two separate buildings.  The first contains the front desk, some conference rooms, and a restaurant and a bar.  The second is a tower with all of the rooms.  

The room I had was a little long in the tooth.  Older furniture and some touches like frayed curtains or a fire exit map that kept falling off the back of the door, were a little concerning.  The bed was comfortable and the shower was hot and strong.  I did think it was odd they kept leaving soap and shampoo every day, even if I was still using the original one.  Seemed a little wasteful., 

There were schematics in the lobby showing what the new rooms and common areas were going to look like after the renovation.  It can't come soon enough.  Also, a funny note, that this hotel bills itself as the UC/Silicon Valley North.  In the hotel guide book it says UC/Oakland South, so kudos to the marketing team for understanding opportunity.

data.title: Really improved- now on to the showers!
data.text:
I make an annual pilgrimage to Union City with a bunch of high school students for a debate tournament and the Crowne Plaza is the tournament hotel.  Over the years, I've seen the hotel get worse and then better again, so I  suppose I'm as much an authority on Union City Crowne Plazas as any one person can be. 

The room updates look phenomenal-- clean, crisp, and comfy. I loved that the bed came with lots of pillows, as a lot of hotels are quite stingy on the pillow front. The sheets were clean and warm, which was excellent. The decor was nice. The desk pulled out to give even more work space where needed.

Most of the bathroom (counter top, sink, mirror) was great, but the shower area had peeling paint and needed something of an update. Perhaps that's next?  I mean, the shower was clean and had good water pressure, but the aesthetics were not great.

Staff was friendly, helpful, and patient which is all you can ask for when they've got a million high school students roaming their property.

data.title: Not the Crowne Plaza I'm accustomed to
data.text: The hotel is a strange!  The staff all super nice.  But the hotel itself leaves a bit to be desired.  As an IHG Spire level member, there are certain things I've come to expect fro Crowne's around the world.  Bottled water in my room being one of them.  Slippers to walk on the often vacuumed but not often washed carpets.  Turn down service, warning of work around the hotel if it will be noisy, especially when the work is right outside of my room!!  However, Spire or not these expectations were not met.  My room is spacious, the internet is solid, the rooms are decently cleaned by the cleaning staff.  however they come around in the afternoon.  Which isn't great when you work in the morning and come back to an untidy room.   Outside of this the breakfast is mediocre, nothing special.  Seeing as the hotel is situated next to the highway, I'd expect sound proof windows so that guest can sleep without feeling as if the highway was running through the room but.. thats not the case, and as traffic increases, so will your frustrationAnd the biggest shocker... Empty minibar.  For those of us with having to work internationally it's simply convenient to have a snack in the room without having to get dressed to run to the vending machine.  And why would a hotel NOT put in a cash cow like a stocked minibar??  I mean really???  All in all for such a costly stay the value is not there.

data.title: Old but still good
data.text:
This hotel honestly is outdated and in need of some TLC, but the customer service at the hotel makes me more than okay to return. 

It is conveniently located to Union Landing and the freeway.  There ample amount of parking was nice, but none close to the building I was checked into, so I had a bit to walk. I didn't mind it though.

I had a skype conference in the morning and the internet connect was reliable & satisfactory.

I ordered room service b/c I was short on time, but I didn't really finish my food. I got the basic stuff --scrambled eggs, toast, bacon & hash.  Although when I ordered it, again the customer service was so nice :) They were very quick as well. I didn't really like the breakfast, the eggs were very wet, the hashbrowns were soggy & so was the toast.  BUT, ehh... it's breakfast. In all honesty, if my husband ate it, he probably would have loved it, but for me... not really. It's okay though.

The shower pressure was nice, but again... the hotel is very old and needs TLC. Wallpaper was coming off, there were cracks everywhere, the carpets had a grimy feeling to where I refused to not where socks. lol BUT being in hospitality, with the quantity of rooms, occupancy percentages, and all the buses in the parking lot... I already came in knowing that those carpets probably don't get shampooed very often. 

I wouldn't mind being a returning guest at this hotel.  Its just so convenient and the staff here is so nice :)
